    • Constructor Detail

      • LinKernighan

        public LinKernighan​(java.util.List<Measurable> coordinates,
                    java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> ids)
        Constructor that creates an instance of the Lin-Kerninghan problem without the optimizations. (Basically the tour it has is the drunken sailor)
        Parameters:
        ArrayList - the coordinates of all the cities
        ArrayList - the id of all the cities

      • getPreviousIdx

        public int getPreviousIdx​(int index)
        This function returns the previous index for the tour, this typically should be x-1 but if x is zero, well, it is the last index.
        Parameters:
        x - the index of the node
        Returns:
        the previous index

      • getNextIdx

        public int getNextIdx​(int index)
        This function returns the next index for the tour, this typically should be x+1 but if x is the last index it should wrap to zero
        Parameters:
        x - the index of the node
        Returns:
        the next index

      • startAlgorithm

        public void startAlgorithm​(int t1,
                           int t2,
                           int t3)
        This function is actually the step four from the lin-kernighan's original paper
        Parameters:
        t1 - the index that references the chosen t1 in the tour
        t2 - the index that references the chosen t2 in the tour
        t3 - the index that references the chosen t3 in the tour
